contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They have ruined your country" or "Your enemies have ruined your country" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Your country is ruined

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I have left the daughter of Zion" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The daughter of Zion is left

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. Possible meanings are 1) "Yahweh will redeem Zion because the people there do what is just, and he will redeem those who repent because they do what Yahweh says is right" or 2) "Yahweh will redeem Zion because he is just, and he will redeem those who repent because he is righteous" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: Zion will be redeemed by justice, and her repentant ones by righteousness

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will destroy those who rebel and sin against him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Rebels and sinners will be crushed together

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and Yahweh will completely do away with those who turn away from him" or "and Yahweh will kill all who reject him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those who abandon Yahweh will be done away with

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Everyone will be cruel to others and will mistreat his neighbor" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The people will be oppressed, every one by another, and every one by his neighbor

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "everyone whose name is on the list of the people who live in Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: everyone who is written down as living in Jerusalem

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "no one will prune it or hoe it" or "no one will cut off the branches that are not needed, and no one will take care of the soil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it will not be pruned nor hoed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People will praise Yahweh of hosts because he is just" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh of hosts will be exalted in his justice

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and smoke filled the temple" or "and smoke filled the palace" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and the house was filled with smoke

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "armies will again destroy the land of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it will again be destroyed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People will stay away from the hills where they once prepared the soil to plant crops" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: They will stay away from all the hills that were cultivated with the hoe

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "I will break your armies to pieces" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: You peoples will be broken to pieces

contextId.information: To "carry out" a plan or command is to do what the person who makes the plan or command wants the hearer to do. These clauses can be stated in active form. AT: "you will not be able to do what you plan to do ... your soldiers will not be able to do what their commanders tell them to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it will not be carried out ... it will not be carried out

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Many people will stumble over the stone, and when they fall they will not get up. And many people will step into the trap, and they will not be able to get out" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Many will stumble over it and fall and be broken, and be ensnared and captured

contextId.information: This is a metaphor that can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) AT: "and those that they lead become confused" or 2) AT: "and Yahweh destroys those that they lead" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and those who are led by them are swallowed up

contextId.information: Translate "Yahweh of hosts" as in [[:en:bible:notes:isa:01:09|1:9]]. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Like fire that scorches the land, the Lord's intense anger will destroy the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Through the fury of Yahweh of hosts the land is scorched

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh has decreed that he will destroy most of those who live in Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Destruction is decreed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the kingdom that people most admire" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the most admired of kingdoms

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "But now God has sent you down to Sheol" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Yet you are now brought down to Sheol

contextId.information: The idea of "is intended" can be expressed with an active verb. AT: "This is the plan that God intends for the whole earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: This is the plan that is intended for the whole earth

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. "People will call one of these cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: One of these cities will be called

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "where we fled to so they would rescue us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: where we fled for help to be rescued

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh showed me a troubling vision" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: A distressing vision has been given to me

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "what I saw has greatly troubled me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I am disturbed by what I saw

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "but the enemy captured your rulers who were not even carrying a bow" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: but they were captured without using a bow

contextId.information: Since people will no longer go to Tyre to buy or sell goods, it will be like they have forgotten about the city. This can be stated in active form. AT: "for seventy years it will be like the people have forgotten about Tyre" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Tyre will be forgotten for seventy years

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will completely devastate the earth and he will remove everything with value" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The earth will be completely devastated and completely stripped

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and Yahweh will declare that the people are guilty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and its inhabitants are found guilty

contextId.information: Here "pit" refers to a dark room or hole in a prison. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will gather them together as his prisoners and lock them in the dungeon of a prison" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: They will be gathered together, prisoners in a pit, and will be shut up in a prison

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you will stop the ruthless people from singing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the song of the ruthless ones is answered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People will say" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It will be said

contextId.information: This question too is used to contrast the severity of God's punishment. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh has not killed the people of Israel like they killed their enemies from other nations." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Have Jacob and Israel been killed as in the slaughter of those nations that were killed by them?

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will purge the sin from the Israelites" or "Yahweh will forgive the sins of the Israelites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the iniquity of Jacob will be atoned for

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will gather you one by one" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you ... will be gathered one by one

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The enemy army will crush the proud drunkards of Samaria as if they were crushing flowers under their feet" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The proud garland of the drunkards of Ephraim will be trodden underfoot

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "in order that the army of Assyria will come and defeat them and take them as captives" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so that they may go and fall backward, and be broken, ensnared, and captured

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will cancel the covenant you have with death, and I will cancel the agreement you have with Sheol" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Your covenant with death will be dissolved, and your agreement with Sheol will not stand

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "the farmer does not separate the caraway seed from the plant with a heavy club" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the caraway seed is not threshed with a sledge

contextId.information: Isaiah describes the correct way for a farmer to separate the seed from the plant. This can be stated in active form. AT: "but he beats the caraway with a stick, and he beats cumin with a rod" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: but caraway is beaten with a stick, and cumin with a rod

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Your enemy will bring you down" or "Your enemy will humble you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: You will be brought down

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "If a person takes the book to someone who cannot read" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: If the book is given to one who cannot read

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "when you observe a holy feast" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: when a holy feast is observed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "For when Yahweh speaks he will shatter the soldiers of Assyria" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For at the voice of Yahweh, Assyria will be shattered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "For long ago Yahweh prepared a place for burning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For a place of burning was prepared long ago

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. "The deceiver" refers to a person who is deceptive. AT: "nor will anyone show respect to the person who deceives" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
contextId.quote: nor the deceiver called principled

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. Also, Isaiah speaks of them no longer being confident as if their confidence were a physical object that is broken. AT: "you will no longer be confident" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: your confidence will be broken

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "For the people will forsake the palace and the crowds will abandon the city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For the palace will be forsaken, the crowded city will be deserted

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "it destroys the forest and completely destroys the city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the forest is destroyed, and the city is completely annihilated

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "others will destroy you" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will be destroyed

contextId.information: This can be written in active form. AT: "the nations scatter" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the nations are scattered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh is greater than anyone else" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh is exalted

contextId.information: Both of the phrases emphasize that there are no travelers on the highways. These can be combined and stated in active form. AT: "People no longer travel on the highways" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The highways are deserted; there are no more travelers

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will forgive the sins of the people who live there" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the people who live there will be forgiven for their iniquity

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "No one will bury their dead" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The bodies of their dead will be thrown out

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I, Yahweh, will slaughter the wild oxen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Wild oxen will be slaughtered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "A highway will be there that has the name The Holy Way" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: A highway will be there called The Holy Way

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "no one will find them there" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they will not be found there

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will not give Jerusalem into the hand of the king of Assyria" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: this city will not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "may you give my life back to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: may my life be given back to me

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "everything that was in his storehouses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: all that was found in his storehouses

contextId.information: These phrases explain how the people are to prepare a highway for Yahweh. They can be stated in active form. AT: "Lift up every valley, and level every mountain and hill" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Every valley will be lifted up, and every mountain and hill will be leveled

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and Yahweh regards them as dust on the scales" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and are regarded like the dust on the scales

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "But the enemy has robbed and plundered this people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: But this is a people robbed and plundered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will save the people of Israel" ([[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Israel will be saved by Yahweh

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "but he designed it so people could live on it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: but designed it to be inhabited

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Turn to me and I will save you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Turn to me and be saved

contextId.information: Here the word "justified" does not refer to Yahweh forgiving their sins, but to proving to the nations that Israel was right to worship him. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will justify all the descendants of Israel" or "Yahweh will vindicate all the descendants of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: In Yahweh all the descendants of Israel will be justified

contextId.information: Even though the servant has been mistreated, he will not be ashamed because he has obeyed Yahweh. This can be stated in active form. AT: "therefore I will not be ashamed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: therefore I am not disgraced

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I see the enemy taking my people away for nothing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: seeing that my people are taken away for nothing

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People considered him as nothing and rejected him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He was despised and rejected by people

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They treated him harshly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He was oppressed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They treated him harshly, judged him, and condemned him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: By coercion and judgment he was condemned

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "And Yahweh will teach all your children" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Then all your children will be taught by Yahweh

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Seek Yahweh while you can still find him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Seek Yahweh while he may be found

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will lead you along peacefully" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: be led along peacefully

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that the righteous people die, and Yahweh takes them away from all that is evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that the righteous is gathered away from the evil

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. The exact meaning in Hebrew is unclear. AT: "that is your lot" or "that is your inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that have been assigned to you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. TA: "The people drive justice back" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Justice is driven back

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The people of Kedar will gather their flocks for you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: All the flocks of Kedar will be gathered together to you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will completely destroy the people of those nations" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those nations will be completely destroyed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "There will no longer be reports of violence in your land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Violence will no longer be heard in your land

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "so that all people may glorify me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that I may be glorified

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People will no longer say about you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It will no more be said of you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. "name" refers to a family relationship. AT: "who never belonged to your family" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: who were never called by your name

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I, the God who always speaks the truth, will bless him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: will be blessed by me, the God of truth

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Glorify Yahweh" or "May Yahweh glorify himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May Yahweh be glorified

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "she will carry you in her arms and bounce you on her knees with delight" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: be carried in her arms, and be dandled on her knees
